Pre-Game Insights: Bahrain will take on Malaysia in their second AFC Asian Cup group game at the Jassim Bin Hamad Stadium on Saturday.
Both teams lost their opening games in Group E and will be looking for their first win of the tournament.
Abdullah Al Hashash scored as Bahrain lost to South Korea 3-1 in their last game.
Malaysia suffered a heavy 4-0 defeat against Jordan in their first game.
Amine Benaddi's availability for the upcoming match is uncertain as the centre-back had to be carried off injured at half-time against South Korea.
Should Safawi Rasid score this weekend, he can climb to the seventh position in the list of all-time scorers for Malaysia.
